text: The Estadio Balear (Catalan: Estadi Balear) is a football stadium in Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain. It was opened in 1960. This stadium is the home of the CD Atlético Baleares. The stadium has 4,200 seats. The field is 102×67 metres. ==History== Estadio Balear opened on 8 May 1960. Its first game was a 2–0 friendly win against Birmingham City. On 14 June 2013, the stadium was closed by Palma city council due. It was closed because it had a risk of collapse. 14 December 2017, the stadium was renovated. The stadium's capacity was lowered to 4,200. During the stadium's closure, CD Atlético Baleares played their games at the nearby . The stadium finished its renovations in August 2019. ==References== == Other websites == *Atlético Baleares official site *Estadios de Espana Category:Football venues in the Balearic Islands Category:1960 establishments in Europe Category:1960s establishments in Spain Category:Buildings and structures in Spain
title: Estadio Balear
